issues.description: The solution repository defines a method named processOrders() instead of the specified checkOrderReady(), so the expected checkOrderReady() method is missing. This name mismatch will confuse students about which method they should implement and may break any tests or references expecting checkOrderReady().
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the method processOrders() in SealSaloon.java to checkOrderReady(), and update all internal calls (e.g., in orderMeal) accordingly to match the problem statement.

issues.description: The problem specification defines a method named `checkOrderReady()`, but the provided solution omits this and instead implements the same logic in a method called `processOrders()`. This inconsistent naming prevents students from clearly mapping the required `checkOrderReady` method to the solution implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the solutionâ€™s `processOrders` method (and its invocation in `orderMeal`) to `checkOrderReady` to match the problem statement.
